com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.devices

Class WZCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.devices.WZCamera

  • public class WZCamera
extends Object
    The WZCamera class provides an interface for accessing and controlling a camera device. The method WZCameraView.getDeviceCameras() can be used to retrieve a list of all cameras.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Identifier for a back facing camera returned by getDirection()

      An identifier used with the hasCapability(int) method to detect support for continuous video focus

      An identifier used with the setFramerate(int) method to turn off all focus modes

      An identifier used with the hasCapability(int) method to detect the presence of a torch (i.e.

      • getNumberOfDeviceCameras

        public static int getNumberOfDeviceCameras()
        Returns the number of cameras detected on the current device.
        Returns:
        The number of cameras detected on the current device.

      • getDeviceCameras

        public static WZCamera[] getDeviceCameras(boolean availableOnly,
                                          boolean withCapabilities)
        Returns an array of WZCamera object instances for each camera detected, and optionally accessible, on the current device.
        Parameters:
        availableOnly - If set to true, the returned array will contain instances for only those camera that could be successfully opened for access.
        withCapabilities - If set to true, the camera's will be interrogated at this time for it's full set of features. This is ordinarily only done the first time the camera is opened for preview. Doing so here can cause performance issues when starting the camera preview
        Returns:
        An array of WZCamera object instances

      • getDeviceCameras

        public static WZCamera[] getDeviceCameras(boolean availableOnly)
        Returns an array of WZCamera object instances for each camera detected, and optionally accessible, on the current device.
        Parameters:
        availableOnly - If set to true, the returned array will contain instances for only those camera that could be successfully opened for access.
        Returns:
        An array of WZCamera object instances

        for detal on the the camera interface

        Indicates if the camera can be opened by the current application

      • getOptimalPreviewSize

        public WZSize getOptimalPreviewSize(WZSize requestedSize)
        Returns the best frame size supported by the device for previewing video with the specified frame size
        Parameters:
        requestedSize - the requested frame size for display
        Returns:
        the best frame size supported by the device for previewing video with the specified frame size

      • getOptimalPreviewSize

        public WZSize getOptimalPreviewSize(WZSize requestedSize,
                                    WZSize minimumSize)
        Returns the best frame size supported by the device for previewing video with the specified frame size that is equal to or larger than the specified minimum size
        Parameters:
        requestedSize - the requested frame size for display
        minimumSize - the minimum frame size to be considered
        Returns:
        the best frame size supported by the device for previewing video with the specified frame size

      • hasCapability

        public boolean hasCapability(int capabilityId)
        Provides an interface to interrogate device support of various capabilities
        Parameters:
        capabilityId - a specifier indicating the capability, one of TORCH, FOCUS_MODE_AUTO, or FOCUS_MODE_CONTINUOUS
        Returns:
        true if the current device supports the specified capability, false otherwise

      • setTorchOn

        public void setTorchOn(boolean torchOn)
        Turns the camera's torch (aka flashlight) on or off
        Parameters:
        torchOn - specify true to turn the torch on, false to turn it off

      • getFocusMode

        public int getFocusMode()
        Returns the camera's active focus mode
        Returns:
        FOCUS_MODE_OFF, FOCUS_MODE_AUTO, or FOCUS_MODE_CONTINUOUS

      • setFocusMode

        public void setFocusMode(int focusMode)
        Sets the camera's active focus mode
        Parameters:
        focusMode - FOCUS_MODE_OFF or FOCUS_MODE_CONTINUOUS

      • setFocusPoint

        public void setFocusPoint(float x,
                          float y,
                          int focusAreaSize)
        Turns on auto focus mode and sets the focus point to the screen coordinate x, y
        Parameters:
        x - the x position of the focus point on the display screen
        y - the y position of the focus point on the display screen

      • toViewCoords

        public RectF toViewCoords(View view,
                          Rect cameraRect)
        Converts camera coordinates to coordinates for the specified view
        Parameters:
        view - The view to map
        cameraRect - A rectangle in camera coordinates
        Returns:
        A rectangle mapped from the camera coordinates to the view coordinates
